messages.subject: re: [samuraihistory] Hi all, im newone here
messages.msgSnippet: 1. Nobunaga was wounded and committed suicide at the Honnoji temple of Kyoto on 21st june 1582 after a fight against Akechi Mitsuhide s troups. The temple was
messages.messageBody:
1. Nobunaga was wounded and committed suicide at the Honnoji temple of Kyoto on 21st june 1582 after a fight against Akechi Mitsuhide's troups. The temple was burned during the fight.
2.The reasons why Takeda Shingen pushed out his father Nobutora are not fully explained but it is believed that it was a combination of personal ambition, bearing in mind the relationship between father and son was not too good, and the growing insatisfaction of some major vassals who resented the high-handed manner of Nobutora in his direction of the clan.



> Message du 20/11/10 21:42
> De : "gaemonmoon"
> A : samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com

>
> 2. why shingen takeda "kick away" his father from his chair as damiyo?
> political motive or else? since we'll know that his father & himself (shingen) is a have a great leadership
>
> thanks all
>
> pride & respect

messages.messageBody:
1. did u'll know how nobunaga death, & is there any prove or evidence about that temple incident? his death or burning body?

2. why shingen takeda "kick away" his father from his chair as damiyo?
political motive or else? since we'll know that his father & himself (shingen) is a have a great leadership

thanks all

pride & respect
